Client.Name: Computer Network Information Center of Chinese Academy of Sciences

Project.Brief history of your project and organi:
The Computer Network Information Center of the Chinese Academy of Sciences was established in March 1995. It is a research, development, construction, operation and service guarantee institution for scientific research informatization and management informatization of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and a demonstration base for information technology innovation and application.
The Computer Network Information Center of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (CNIC) is a scientific research institution under the Chinese Academy of Sciences, mainly engaged in computer network technology and database technology research. CNIC was established in April 1995 and is a scientific research support institution developed in the process of building China's science and technology network and scientific database. China Science and Technology Network is an Internet network covering the whole country developed on the basis of the "China National Computing and Network Facilities Project" built with a loan from the World Bank, and was the first in China to be connected to the Internet.
Project.Describe the data being stored onto File:
Landsat-8 is basically the same as Landsat 1-7 in terms of spatial resolution and spectral characteristics. The satellite has a total of 11 bands. The spatial resolution of bands 1-7, 9-11 is 30 meters, and band 8 is a panchromatic band with a resolution of 15 meters. The satellite can achieve global coverage once every 16 days.
The OLI land imager has 9 bands and an imaging width of 185x185km. Compared with the ETM sensor on Landsat-7, the OLI land imager has made the following adjustments: 1. The band range of Band 5 is adjusted to 0.845–0.885 μm, eliminating the influence of water vapor absorption at 0.825 μm; 2. The panchromatic band range of Band 8 is narrower, so that vegetation and non-vegetation areas can be better distinguished; 3. Two new bands are added. Band 1 blue band (0.433–0.453 μm) is mainly used for coastal observations, and Band 9 shortwave infrared band (1.360–1.390 μm) is used for cloud detection. The TIRS thermal infrared sensor carried by LandSat-8 is mainly used to collect heat loss in two hot zones on the earth, with the goal of understanding the water consumption in the observed zone.
Project.How will you be distributing your data t: Cloud storage (i.e. S3), HTTP or FTP server, Shipping hard drives
